moves.9. O-O O-O 10. Rxf4: Now that both players have castled, the complications can begin.
moves.12. Bxe5: Seizing the diagonal is a higher priority than un-doubling my Pawns.
moves.13... b5: An attempt to decoy my Bishop off its present diagonal.
moves.14... Bb7: Applying pressure to the advanced Pawn.
moves.17. Qf5: I'm still guarding the advanced P.
moves.18. Qxf6+: Gaining material with tempo. 18... Q-N2 is the best reply.
moves.19. d6+: ...enables this deadly discovered check. Black can only avoid mate by giving up ruinous amounts of material, so Black resigns.
